image.alt: Smiling patients in the office at Gill Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: At Gill Orthodontics we believe every smile tells a story. As a family‑oriented orthodontic practice serving patients ages six and up, we provide affordable, modern orthodontic care in a warm, welcoming environment. Dr. Gill and the team take time to listen, answer questions, and design personalized treatment plans—whether you need traditional braces, clear aligners, or retainers—to help you achieve a healthy, beautiful smile. Schedule a consultation today to learn more.

items.title: Personalized Care
items.text: We create individualized treatment plans and keep communication open so you’re an active participant in your smile journey.

items.title: Experienced Clinicians
items.text: Our clinicians pursue ongoing education and use modern techniques to deliver effective, efficient care.

items.title: Safety & Standards
items.text: We follow ADA, OSHA, and CDC infection‑control guidelines and maintain high clinical standards.

items.title: Family Friendly
items.text: A welcoming team focused on making visits positive for patients of all ages.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Jared Gill, DMD leads Gill Orthodontics and maintains active memberships in the American Association of Orthodontists, the North Dakota Dental Association, and the Heartland Study Club. He completed undergraduate studies at Utah State University, earned his Doctorate of Dental Medicine from Case Western Reserve University, and completed orthodontic specialty training at St. Barnabas Hospital in New York. Dr. Gill lives in West Fargo with his wife and four children and is active in the community.

image.alt: Dr. Jared Gill, orthodontist at Gill Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: We offer a range of orthodontic services, from traditional braces to clear aligners and retainers, tailored to patients of all ages.

image.alt: Exterior banner image for Gill Orthodontics showing the practice signage

paragraphs.text: At Gill Orthodontics we are devoted to maintaining and enhancing the natural beauty of your smile using conservative, state-of-the-art procedures that deliver long-lasting results. Every treatment plan is customized to fit the patient’s needs, lifestyle, and goals.

We promise to treat patients with compassion and respect, provide ethical care, and communicate clearly at every step. Our team is available to address concerns and handle emergencies so patients feel supported throughout treatment.

We offer a full range of orthodontic options, including fixed braces (metal and ceramic) and clear aligners, focused interceptive care for growing smiles, and retention strategies to protect your investment long term.
Through ongoing professional education, modern technology, and gentle clinical techniques, we make comfortable, high-quality orthodontic care accessible to families in our community.

image.alt: Dr. Jared Gill smiling in his practice headshot

paragraphs.text: I really enjoy practicing orthodontics. Creating beautiful, functional smiles and watching patients gain confidence is the most rewarding part of my work. I started in orthodontics as a teenager, working in labs and learning the hands-on craft that led me into dental and specialty training.

My approach blends clinical precision with clear communication so patients understand their options and feel comfortable throughout treatment. I provide comprehensive care for children and adults, and take pride in making each visit positive and productive.

image.alt: Dr. Jared Gill headshot

paragraphs.text: Undergraduate: Utah State University. Doctorate of Dental Medicine: Case Western Reserve University, Cleveland. Orthodontic specialty training: St. Barnabas Hospital, New York.

I regularly attend local, state, and national orthodontic meetings and participate in the Heartland Study Club to stay current with proven treatment methods and new technologies that improve patient outcomes.

image.alt: Dr. Jared Gill professional portrait

paragraphs.text: Professional memberships include the American Association of Orthodontists, the North Dakota Dental Association, and active participation in the Heartland Study Club. These affiliations help me collaborate with peers and bring the best care to our patients.

image.alt: Dr. Jared Gill portrait

paragraphs.text: I live in West Fargo with my wife Katie and our four children. When I’m not at the office I enjoy reading, fishing, gardening, biking, and playing video games with my kids. I’m active in my children’s schools and church, and I value giving back to our local community.

image.alt: Dr. Jared Gill smiling

paragraphs.text: The first step towards a beautiful, healthy smile is to schedule an appointment. Please contact our office by phone or complete an online appointment request.
Online appointment request: https://www.gillbraces.com/AppointmentRequest.aspx (alternate: https://www.gillbraces.com/appointment-request/).

image.alt: Father with daughter at reception of dentist's surgery

paragraphs.text: For your convenience, we accept cash, personal checks, money orders, and most major credit cards. Payment is expected at the time services are performed.
If your treatment plan requires more comprehensive dental work and you need to discuss financial arrangements, please contact our office.
Please contact our office for insurance details. We look forward to hearing from you.

og_meta.title: Get Started | Gill Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Schedule your first visit at Gill Orthodontics. Call (701) 232-1500 or request an appointment online.

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages receiving orthodontic care

paragraphs.text: Orthodontic treatment corrects misaligned teeth and jaws to improve function, oral health and confidence. At Gill Orthodontics we offer a full range of options for children, teens and adults, using modern techniques to create efficient, comfortable treatment plans tailored to each patient.

image.alt: Smiling family enjoying time together

paragraphs.text: Fixed braces use brackets and archwires to gently move teeth into their proper positions. They are a reliable choice for a wide range of bite and alignment issues and are adjusted periodically to guide tooth movement over the course of treatment.

image.alt: Close up of traditional metal braces on teeth

paragraphs.text: Ceramic braces offer a tooth-colored alternative to metal brackets for patients who want a less noticeable option. They are effective for many cases, though care with staining foods and drinks helps maintain their appearance.

image.alt: Patient smiling with discreet ceramic braces

paragraphs.text: Damon braces use a low-friction bracket system intended to move teeth efficiently with fewer adjustments. They can be an excellent option when a patient and orthodontist determine that a fixed appliance is the best path to the desired result.

image.alt: Modern orthodontic treatment room interior

paragraphs.text: Invisalign<sup>®</sup> and other clear aligner systems use a series of removable, nearly invisible trays to move teeth. They work well for many patients and make oral hygiene and eating easier because the trays can be removed for cleaning and meals.
Not every case is a candidate for aligners, so we evaluate your bite, x-rays and treatment goals before recommending the best approach.

image.alt: Close-up of clear aligner on model teeth

paragraphs.text: Retention is a critical final phase of orthodontic care. Custom retainers help stabilize tooth positions while bone remodels. We provide guidance on wear schedules and cleaning so long-term results are easier to maintain.
Losing or not wearing a retainer as directed can allow teeth to shift back, so careful follow-up and proper care are essential to protect your investment.

image.alt: Young woman holding a clear orthodontic retainer

paragraphs.text: Lingual braces are attached to the tongue side of the teeth, keeping the appliance out of sight. They can be an effective option for patients seeking a fully hidden fixed solution, though they may require an adjustment period for speech and comfort.

image.alt: Two teens smiling together after orthodontic treatment

paragraphs.text: Palatal expanders create additional space in the upper jaw to address crowding and crossbites. Often used in growing patients, these appliances can simplify later orthodontic treatment by guiding jaw development early.

image.alt: Young patient receiving early orthodontic intervention
Schedule a consultation with Gill Orthodontics

og_meta.title: Contact Gill Orthodontics | Fargo Orthodontist
og_meta.description: Contact Gill Orthodontics in Fargo for appointments, directions, and patient forms. Call (701) 232-1500 or use our online request form.

image.alt: Patient smiling with orthodontic braces in our Emeryville office

paragraphs.text: Wear the retainer as directed – This phase of treatment is critical. The hard work has been done, the braces are off and now it is tempting not to wear the retainer as often as the orthodontist recommends. Retainers are needed to give the muscles, tissues and bones time to stabilize the teeth in their new alignment. Failure to wear the retainer as directed can have regrettable consequences, such as teeth returning to their original position, added expense and lost time.

accordion.header: How long will I be in braces?

paragraphs.text: Some cases can be completed in less than a year. More difficult cases take longer. The average case will take from 2-3 years. Our appointment system and the Doctors' mechanics are designed to reduce the number of times you will need to be seen and the overall length of treatment. Treatment time varies with the severity of the case, patient cooperation,and growth and development. The Doctors will attempt to estimate treatment time at the initial appointment.

image.alt: Happy Family Portrait

accordion.header: What do I need to consider when using a retainer?

paragraphs.text: There are a few basic things to consider for proper use and maintenance of your retainer. Don’t lose the appliance – Removable retainers are very easy to lose. It is advisable to place your retainer in the case it came in while eating, drinking and brushing. Leaving a retainer folded in a napkin at a restaurant or in a public restroom can be very costly if lost because a replacement must be created. A brightly colored case serves as a great reminder. Don’t drink while wearing a retainer – excess liquid trapped under the trays can intensify acid exposure to teeth, increasing the probability of tooth decay. Don’t eat while wearing a retainer – it can be difficult and may damage the device. Clean the retainer properly – removable retainers can become breeding grounds for calculus and bacteria; clean the inside and outside as often as possible. Wear the retainer as directed – this phase of treatment is critical to stabilize teeth in their new alignment and avoid relapse.

image.alt: Couple Enjoying Time Together

paragraphs.text: Protect your investment by treating retainers like a daily essential: keep them in their case when not in use, avoid eating or drinking while wearing them, and clean them regularly with a toothbrush or a denture/retainer cleaner depending on the type. If a retainer is lost or damaged, contact us promptly to arrange a replacement so your teeth remain stable.
